prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.
Character 1
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 2
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That night, I was up at the top of Mt. Poniponi, the mountain next to the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: I hate crowds, so I climbed up there to pray in peace
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: I know it's a no-no, but since there was no one around...
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: ...I used my binoculars to spy on the rite at the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's when I saw the accused... stab the high priest with a dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To find the contradiction, let's analyze the evidence and testimonies related to the crime at the Inner Sanctum.

1. **Ihmus' Testimony Analysis:**
   - **Testimony 0:** Ihmus claims to have been at the top of Mt. Poniponi.
   - **Testimony 1:** Ihmus mentions climbing there to pray peacefully.
   - **Testimony 2:** Ihmus admits to using binoculars, despite it being a "no-no."
   - **Testimony 3:** Ihmus claims to have used binoculars to observe the rite at the Inner Sanctum.
   - **Testimony 4:** Ihmus states having seen the accused stab the high priest with a dagger.

2. **Evidence Analysis:**
   - **Key Point:** Mt. Poniponi and the Inner Sanctum are separate locations with distinct elevations mentioned in Evidence 11 ("Mountain Range Poster"). Mt. Poniponi is at 2298 meters, and the Inner Sanctum is at 2310 meters.
   - **Relevance of Binoculars:** Considering the elevation difference and the locations, it's plausible that even with binoculars, accurately witnessing a stabbing event would be extremely challenging if not impossible, especially given the details about the curtain around the sanctum as mentioned in Evidence 4 ("Ritual Curtain").

3. **Contradiction:**
   - **Testimony 3** states that Ihmus used binoculars to spy on the rite, which implies visibility into the sanctum.
   - **Evidence:** The **Ritual Curtain (Evidence 4)** specifically mentions that the entrance was shut during the rite, which would prevent clear visibility of the events within the sanctum from outside. This means Ihmus seeing the stabbing as described becomes highly improbable or impossible with the curtain closed.
   
The testimony that claims Ihmus could see inside the sanctum and witness the stabbing is contradicted by the evidence of the shut ritual curtain that obstructs the view. Thus, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 4.

{"evidence": 4, "testimony": 3}

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I saw their shadowy silhouettes, projected against the ritual curtain!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: She was just a shadow, but I could tell it was the accused, reverse-gripping that dagger!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To identify a contradiction between evidence and testimony, we need to examine the details closely.

Let's start by analyzing the testimonies:

1. Testimony 0: "I saw their shadowy silhouettes, projected against the ritual curtain!"
2. Testimony 1: "The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night."
3. Testimony 2: "She was just a shadow, but I could tell it was the accused, reverse-gripping that dagger!"

Now, let's look at the evidences:

1. Evidence 2: **May 9th Newspaper**
   - It includes weather information pertinent to the day of the Purification Rite.
   - Specifically, it mentions: "The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today."

2. Evidence 4: **Ritual Curtain**
   - It states that there's a curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. 
   - Importantly, "The entrance was shut during the rite."

Now let's analyze Testimony 1: "The figures were created by the light of the full moon on that clear and still night."

Cross-reference this with the May 9th Newspaper:
- The description of the weather is consistent with the statement of having "clear skies."

However, the key contradiction comes with the visibility of the moon in relation to the ritual and curtain setup:

If the entrance was shut during the rite (Evidence 4: Ritual Curtain), and the figures were projected within the sanctum, it would imply these figures could not have been created by the moonlight if it was outside and the entrance was shut. Thus, there shouldn't have been a shadow created by the moonlight inside.

Therefore, Testimony 1 (about the figures being created by moonlight) contradicts the details provided in Evidence 4 (Ritual Curtain).

{"evidence": 4, "testimony": 1}

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was never at the Inner Sanctum, I tell ya!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: That much I'm sure of, even with the fuzzy memory.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: Besides, it woulda been impossible to get there in the first place!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: No one could climb up those cliffs. The rocks are all loose and crumbly!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: The plaza gate is locked from the side facing the Inner Sanctum.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 5
Testimony: It's not like I can fly through the air, either!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 6
Testimony: Boy, you lawyers sure are scary!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To find the contradiction, let's analyze the testimonies and the evidences provided.

We are looking for a testimony that claims an action or fact is impossible, yet an evidence suggests otherwise.

### Testimonies Analysis
Let's focus on Ihmus' testimonies:

- Testimony 0: Claims to have never been at the Inner Sanctum.
- Testimony 1: Expresses doubt about being there due to poor memory.
- Testimony 2: Asserts impossibility of getting to the Inner Sanctum.
- Testimony 3: Mentions the cliffs being unscalable with loose and crumbly rocks.
- Testimony 4: Discusses the plaza gate's lock situation.
- Testimony 5: Claims not being able to fly through the air.
- Testimony 6: Expresses fear of lawyers.

Testimony 3 and Testimony 5 both offer specific reasons why it would allegedly be impossible for Ihmus to have accessed the Inner Sanctum.

### Evidence Analysis
Now let's look at pieces of evidence that might contradict these testimonies:

- Evidence 11: Mountain Range Poster - It includes a photo showing the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. The description details the location being higher than the mountain itself. This suggests that there's a path to the Inner Sanctum.
- Evidence 26: Rebel Hideout Photo - Includes a luminol reaction. Suggests there may be hidden or unconventional paths known to certain individuals like rebels.

### Contradiction:
Testimony 3 (“No one could climb up those cliffs. The rocks are all loose and crumbly!”) claims the cliffs are impossible to scale. Yet, the Mountain Range Poster (Evidence 11) suggests the area is accessible and that the Inner Sanctum is higher than Mt. Poniponi, implying some sort of feasible path must exist to ascend to such a point.

Therefore, the claim that nobody could climb the cliffs is contradicted by the evidence that there is a known high path leading to the Inner Sanctum.

### Conclusion
The contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 11. Here is the JSON formatted answer:

```json
{"evidence": 11, "testimony": 3}
```

Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.
Character 3
Name: Tahrust Inmee
Description: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.
Character 4
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 5
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.
Character 6
Name: Puhray Zeh'lot
Description: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
Character 7
Name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
Description: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
Character 8
Name: Beh'leeb Inmee
Description: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Rites Guide
Description: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists. It reads: The Purification Rite is a three-part ceremony held when the moon is directly over the summit of Mt. Poniponi. It begins with the Transformation Rite. The high priest reads scripture dons the robes of Lady Kee'ra, which have been purified with incense. Next is the Rite of Water, in which the priestess enters the spring dressed as Lady Kee'ra, and the high priest purifies both Lady Kee'ra and her dagger. The ceremony ends with the Rite of Fire, in which the priestess circles the sacred flames to purify her soul. The two then devote themselves to prayer until the rite comes to a close two days later at noontime.
Evidence 2
Name: May 9th Newspaper
Description: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things. [caption] It reads: - Lady Kee'ra Returns to Battle Rebels - The Lady Kee'ra-like figure that appeared two years ago remains a mystery. Some town elders see her as Lady Kee'ra in the flesh. Such rumors are fueling the enthusiasm for today's Purification Rite. - Today's Purification Rite - The thick, white ice that froze the ground from the Inner Sanctum to the Plaza of Devotion until yesterday has melted. The rite can now go on as planned. We give thanks for the blessings of the Holy Mother and Lady Kee'ra. Hap'piraki! - Escaped Prisoner Alert! - Police are asking the kingdom's subjects to be on the lookout for a male insurgent who escaped from Royal Penitentiary No. 4 yesterday. - Weather Forecast - The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather. Be warned, however, that we will see a cold front move in overnight.
Evidence 3
Name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 4
Name: Ritual Curtain
Description: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.
Evidence 5
Name: Bloodstained Letter
Description: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.
Evidence 6
Name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
Description: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.
Evidence 7
Name: Inner Sanctum Photo
Description: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.
Evidence 8
Name: Maya's Statement
Description: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.
Evidence 9
Name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
Description: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.
Evidence 10
Name: Warbaa'd Arrow
Description: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.
Evidence 11
Name: Mountain Range Poster
Description: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area. Mt. Poniponi is 2298 meters tall and to the west. The Inner Sanctum is 2310 meters tall and to the east.
Evidence 12
Name: Envelope
Description: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.
Evidence 13
Name: Wanted Poster
Description: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.
Evidence 14
Name: Plumed Punisher Strap
Description: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.
Evidence 15
Name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
Description: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.
Evidence 16
Name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
Description: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.
Evidence 17
Name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.
Evidence 18
Name: Warbaa'd Dagger
Description: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.
Evidence 19
Name: Brand New Flag
Description: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.
Evidence 20
Name: Nahmanda Flower
Description: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.
Evidence 21
Name: Beh'leeb's Statement
Description: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.
Evidence 22
Name: Family Photo
Description: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.
Evidence 23
Name: Tome of Secrets
Description: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.
Evidence 24
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.
Evidence 25
Name: Golden Orb
Description: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.
Evidence 26
Name: Rebel Hideout Photo
Description: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance. A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.
Evidence 27
Name: Warbaa'd Statue
Description: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: That evening, I was enjoying a trek through the night sky with my homemade paraglider.
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 1
Testimony: But just as Mt. Poniponi was drawing near, something terrible happened!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 2
Testimony: An accident forced me to make an emergency landing at the Inner Sanctum!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 3
Testimony: Gale force winds came out of nowhere, so I made an emergency landing at the sanctum!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 4
Testimony: As I landed, I banged my head, causing me to lose my memory!
Person: Ihmus
Testimony 5
Testimony: So you see, I ended up at the Inner Sanctum purely by accident!
Person: Ihmus

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To identify a contradiction between the testimonies and evidence, let's break down the relevant information:

1. **Testimony 3** states that Ihmus made an emergency landing at the sanctum due to "gale force winds."

2. **Evidence 2** (May 9th Newspaper) reports the weather forecast: "The area around the Inner Sanctum will enjoy calm, clear skies today. The warmer temperature will make for excellent prayer weather."

The contradiction here is quite clear. Ihmus claims that he was forced to make an emergency landing at the Inner Sanctum due to gale force winds. However, the newspaper indicates that the weather was calm and clear at the time, which contradicts Ihmus's testimony of adverse weather conditions.

Thus, the evidence and testimony pair that contradicts each other is:

{"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}
